candidates.name: Brent Cairns
candidates.why_elect: I have strong links with businesses and residents in the town due to setting up the website directory https://kaiapoi.info and creating the Kaiapoi food forest. I am someone that gets things done.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about Kaiapoi and the district. Ever since I moved here I wanted to be involved to make it the best river town. I have and continue to volunteer for many organisations and want to make the next step in being a councillor.

candidates.name: Martin Pinkham
candidates.why_elect: I am a professional engineer, with senior engineering and management roles in the private sector and am experienced in reviewing and monitoring expenditure of multimillion projects. I am passionate about the development of our district, but improvements need to be good value for money.
candidates.why_stand: We need an exciting, and sustainable, Kaiapoi Town Centre, a clean river, improved public transport, and the Woodend bypass. Fresh thinking, along with my skills and experience in infrastructure development and asset management are vital to ensure that ratepayers get improved performance, and lower costs, from the council.

candidates.name: Shona Powell
candidates.why_elect: The last three years as a community board chair were a great apprenticeship for council. I have a proven track record of standing up for the interests of the communities I serve. I am well equipped to handle council governance with my background in management and leadership. Focus on solutions.
candidates.why_stand: I have used the phrase "Expect More." and I think that sums up my motivation. I love this area and when I have to head into the city I smile when coming back over the Waimakariri river as I am back in this wonderful place that is our home.

candidates.name: Philip Redmond
candidates.why_elect: I first became involved in local government in 1980 when I was elected to the Kaiapoi Borough Council at the age of 26. I practiced law in Kaiapoi for almost 40 years and elected to the KTCB in 2016. Extensive community involvement led to receiving a Queens Service Medal in June 2019.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about north Canterbury, its lifestyle and community well being. I am a sitting board member and very much community focussed. I like to give back to the community that supported me in my law practice for almost 40 years. A good place to raise a family.

candidates.name: Michael Joseph Bate
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in our community my whole life and i am a keen outdoors person, fisherman and hunter. I am saddened and disappointed with the authorities attitude towards our environment and our basic wellbeing. I have the benefit of being tied to no political party.
candidates.why_stand: I can see that our district has severe environmental issues that have been ignored or pushed into the background in past years. I would like our district to be environmentally clean to the benefit of our residents and wildlife.
